Virtual Learning Tutor (ViLT)

vilt package

Submodules

vilt.app module

vilt.app.clean_all_chatbots()[source]

Cleans up all chatbot instances for all students in the system.

vilt.app.clean_chatbot(email, selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

Cleans up a chatbot instance for a specific user and subject.

If a conversation is active, it is ended before removing the chatbot.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • selected_career (str) – The career associated with the chatbot and the user.

  • selected_subject (str) – The subject associated with the chatbot and the user.

vilt.app.clean_chatbots_by_student(student)[source]

Cleans up all chatbot instances associated with a specific student.

Parameters:

student (dict) – Dictionary containing student information, including email and enrolled subjects.

vilt.app.kill_handler(*args)[source]

Handles system termination by cleaning up chatbots and stopping processes.

Parameters:

*args (Python object) – Additional arguments passed by the system signal handler.

vilt.careermanager module

class vilt.careermanager.CareersManager(db_careers=None, path_docs=None)[source]

Bases: object

Manages career and subject data stored in a database, allowing insertion, deletion, and querying.

delete_careers()[source]

Deletes all career records from the database.

process_from_csv()[source]

Processes all CSV files in the document path and stores career data in the database.

query_careers()[source]

Retrieves all career records from the database.

Returns:

A list of career documents from the database.

Return type:

list

query_subjects(career)[source]

Retrieves all subjects associated with a given career.

Parameters:

career (str) – The name of the career to search for.

Returns:

A list of subjects related to the specified career.

Return type:

list

store_careers(list_docs)[source]

Reads career data from CSV files and stores it in the database.

Parameters:

list_docs (list) – List of CSV filenames containing career and subject data.

vilt.chatbotmanager module

class vilt.chatbotmanager.Chatbot(prompt, selected_career, selected_subject, use_openai=True, processed_docs=None)[source]

Bases: object

Chatbot class that manages interactions using an LLM model.

configure_llm(db_path)[source]

Configures the chatbot with OpenAI LLM and vector embeddings.

Parameters:

db_path (str) – Path to the database containing embeddings.

configure_local_llm(db_path)[source]

Configures a local LLM using Ollama and LangChain.

Parameters:

db_path (str) – Path to the database containing embeddings.

init_openai_llm()[source]

Initializes an OpenAI-based language model.

send_sse_data()[source]

Handles server-sent events (SSE) for streaming chatbot responses.

train()[source]

Trains the chatbot using available embeddings.

Returns:

True if training was successful, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

class vilt.chatbotmanager.ChatbotManager[source]

Bases: object

Manages multiple chatbot instances for different users and subjects.

add_chatbot(email, selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

Adds a chatbot for a specific user, career, and subject.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • selected_career (str) – The career associated with the chatbot and the user.

  • selected_subject (str) – The subject associated with the chatbot and the user.

Returns:

correct – True if the chatbot was successfully trained and added, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

find_chatbot(email, selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

Finds the position of a chatbot for a specific user, career, and subject.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • selected_career (str) – The career associated with the chatbot and the user.

  • selected_subject (str) – The subject associated with the chatbot and the user.

Returns:

pos – The index of the chatbot in the user’s list, or -1 if not found.

Return type:

int

remove_chatbot(email, pos)[source]

Removes a chatbot for a specific user based on its position in the list.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email of the user.

  • pos (int) – The index of the chatbot to remove.

class vilt.chatbotmanager.StreamHandler(sse_event_queue)[source]

Bases: BaseCallbackHandler

Handles streaming events from the LLM and forwards them to the SSE event queue.

on_llm_end(response: LLMResult, **kwargs) → None[source]

Handles the event when the LLM completes processing a request.

Parameters:

response (LLMResult) – The result returned by the LLM.

on_llm_error(error: BaseException, **kwargs) → None[source]

Handles errors that occur during LLM processing.

Parameters:

error (BaseException) – The exception raised during processing.

on_llm_new_token(token: str, **kwargs) → None[source]

Handles the event when a new token is generated by the LLM.

Parameters:

token (str) – The newly generated token.

on_llm_start(serialized: Dict[str, Any], prompts: List[str], **kwargs) → None[source]

Handles the event when the LLM starts processing a request.

Parameters:

  • serialized (Dict[str, Any]) – Serialized information about the LLM request.

  • prompts (List[str]) – List of prompts sent to the LLM.

vilt.chatbotmanager.delete_rubbish(db_path)[source]

Deletes unnecessary files from the database directory.

Parameters:

db_path (str) – Path to the database directory.

vilt.chatbotmanager.exist_embeddings(db_path)[source]

Checks if embeddings exist in the specified directory.

Parameters:

db_path (str) – Path to the database directory.

Returns:

exists – True if embeddings exist, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

vilt.dashmanager module

vilt.dashmanager.create_conversations_indicator(value, text)[source]

Creates a Plotly indicator graph for conversations.

Parameters:

  • value (int or float) – The numerical value to display in the indicator.

  • text (str) – The title of the indicator.

Returns:

A Plotly figure representing the indicator.

Return type:

go.Figure

vilt.dashmanager.create_feedback_indicator(radio_value_trace, text, max_value=10)[source]

Creates a Plotly gauge indicator for feedback metrics.

Parameters:

  • radio_value_trace (float) – The value to be displayed in the gauge.

  • text (str) – The title of the indicator.

  • max_value (int, optional) – The maximum value of the gauge (default is 10).

Returns:

A Plotly figure representing the gauge indicator.

Return type:

go.Figure

vilt.dashmanager.create_layout(email='', subject='--')[source]

Creates the main dashboard layout with various filters, graphs, and indicators.

Parameters:

  • email (str, optional) – The user’s email address (default is an empty string).

  • subject (str, optional) – The selected subject to filter the dashboard (default is ‘–‘).

Returns:

layout – The structured layout for the dashboard.

Return type:

dash.html.Div

vilt.dashmanager.find_keyword(keyword, keywords_by_student)[source]

Finds the index of a keyword in a list of keyword-frequency pairs.

Parameters:

  • keyword (str) – The keyword to search for.

  • keywords_by_student (list) – A list of keyword-frequency pairs.

Returns:

pos – The index of the keyword, or -1 if not found.

Return type:

int

vilt.dashmanager.update_figures(response, total_time_plot, conversations_plot, radar_plot, cloud_list)[source]

Updates the dashboard figures based on response data.

Parameters:

  • response (TestResponse object) – The response object containing the updated data.

  • total_time_plot (any) – Placeholder for total time plot.

  • conversations_plot (any) – Placeholder for conversations plot.

  • radar_plot (any) – Placeholder for radar chart.

  • cloud_list (any) – Placeholder for word cloud data.

Returns:

Updated values for all figures.

Return type:

tuple

vilt.dashmanager.update_indicators(response, mean_time_indicator, conversations_indicator, mean_conversations_indicator, mean_size_conversations_indicator, student_conversations_indicator, precision_feedback_indicator, utility_feedback_indicator, learning_feedback_indicator, mean_feedback_indicator, students_feedback_indicator)[source]

Updates the dashboard indicators based on response data.

Parameters:

  • response (TestResponse object) – The response object containing the updated data.

  • mean_time_indicator (any) – Placeholder for mean conversation time indicator.

  • conversations_indicator (any) – Placeholder for total conversations indicator.

  • mean_conversations_indicator (any) – Placeholder for average conversations per student indicator.

  • mean_size_conversations_indicator (any) – Placeholder for average conversation size indicator.

  • student_conversations_indicator (any) – Placeholder for student-specific conversations indicator.

  • precision_feedback_indicator (any) – Placeholder for precision feedback indicator.

  • utility_feedback_indicator (any) – Placeholder for utility feedback indicator.

  • learning_feedback_indicator (any) – Placeholder for learning feedback indicator.

  • mean_feedback_indicator (any) – Placeholder for overall feedback indicator.

  • students_feedback_indicator (any) – Placeholder for student feedback summary.

Returns:

Updated values for all indicators.

Return type:

tuple

vilt.databasemanager module

class vilt.databasemanager.DBManager[source]

Bases: object

Manages database operations such as connecting, inserting, deleting, and querying data.

collection_exists(collection_name)[source]

Checks if a specific collection exists in the database.

Parameters:

collection_name (str) – The name of the collection to check.

Returns:

True if the collection exists, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

connect_database(mongo_db)[source]

Connects to the specified MongoDB database.

Parameters:

mongo_db (str) – The name of the database to connect to.

create_collection(collection_name)[source]

Creates a new collection in the database if it does not already exist.

Parameters:

collection_name (str) – The name of the collection to create.

Returns:

created – True if the collection was created, False if it already exists.

Return type:

bool

delete_collection(collection_name)[source]

Deletes a collection from the database if it exists.

Parameters:

collection_name (str) – The name of the collection to delete.

delete_entity(collection_name, condition, total=False)[source]

Deletes documents from a collection based on a condition.

Parameters:

  • collection_name (str) – The name of the collection from which documents will be deleted.

  • condition (dict) – The condition to match documents for deletion.

  • total (bool, optional) – If True, deletes all matching documents; if False, deletes only the first match (default is False).

disconnect_database()[source]

Closes the database connection.

insert_into_database(collection_name, info)[source]

Inserts a document into the specified collection.

Parameters:

  • collection_name (str) – The name of the collection where the document will be inserted.

  • info (dict) – The document to insert.

query_database(collection_name, condition=None)[source]

Queries documents from a specified collection.

Parameters:

  • collection_name (str) – The name of the collection to query.

  • condition (dict, optional) – The query condition to filter documents (default is None, which retrieves all documents).

Returns:

A list of documents that match the query condition.

Return type:

list

update_collection(collection_name, query, updating, many=True)[source]

Updates documents in a specified collection based on a query condition.

Parameters:

  • collection_name (str) – The name of the collection where documents will be updated.

  • query (dict) – The query condition to match documents.

  • updating (dict) – The update operation to apply.

  • many (bool, optional) – If True, updates all matching documents; if False, updates only the first match (default is True).

Returns:

True if the update was performed successfully, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

list

Parameters:

db_path (str) – Path to the directory containing PDF files.

Returns:

True if at least one PDF was converted, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

db_path (str) – Path to the directory containing JSON documents.

vilt.embeddingmanager.create_vectors(subject_dirs)[source]

Processes subject directories, converting PDFs to JSON and generating embeddings.

Parameters:

subject_dirs (list) – List of subject directories to process.

Parameters:

subject_dirs (list) – List of directories to clean.

Parameters:

vilt.infomanager module

class vilt.infomanager.Conversation[source]

Bases: object

Represents a conversation with metadata and feedback.

set_conversation(date, time_init, time_end, text, feedback, keywords, active=False)[source]

Sets conversation attributes.

Parameters:

  • date (str) – The date when the conversation took place (format: DD/MM/YYYY).

  • time_init (str) – The start time of the conversation (format: HH:MM:SS).

  • time_end (str) – The end time of the conversation (format: HH:MM:SS).

  • text (str) – The content of the conversation.

  • feedback (dict) – A dictionary containing feedback related to the conversation.

  • keywords (list) – A list of keywords extracted from the conversation.

  • active (bool, optional) – Indicates whether the conversation is active (default is False).

class vilt.infomanager.GlobalInfoSubject(selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

Bases: object

Represents global information about a subject across students.

Associates a student with subject information values.

Parameters:

  • student (str) – The name or identifier of the student.

  • info_values (InfoValues) – The information values associated with the student for the subject.

class vilt.infomanager.InfoSubject(selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

Bases: object

Represents a subject with associated metadata.

set_info_subject(min_time, max_time, total_time, times, conversations, global_keywords)[source]

Updates subject information values.

Parameters:

  • min_time (timedelta) – Minimum recorded interaction time.

  • max_time (timedelta) – Maximum recorded interaction time.

  • total_time (timedelta) – Total accumulated interaction time.

  • times (int) – Total number of recorded interactions.

  • conversations (list) – List of conversations related to the subject.

  • global_keywords (dict) – Dictionary of global keywords and their frequencies.

class vilt.infomanager.InfoValues[source]

Bases: object

Stores statistics and keyword information for a subject.

set_info_values(min_time, max_time, total_time, times, conversations, global_keywords)[source]

Sets specific values for the subject’s statistics and conversations.

Parameters:

  • min_time (timedelta) – Minimum recorded interaction time.

  • max_time (timedelta) – Maximum recorded interaction time.

  • total_time (timedelta) – Total accumulated interaction time.

  • times (int) – Total number of recorded interactions.

  • conversations (list) – List of conversations related to the subject.

  • global_keywords (dict) – Dictionary of global keywords and their frequencies.

Returns:

  • career (str) – Extracted career name.

  • subject (str) – Extracted subject name.

vilt.infomanager.get_string_from_career_subject(subject)[source]

Converts a subject dictionary into a formatted string.

vilt.infomanager.update_subject_parameters(subject)[source]

Computes time-related statistics for a subject’s conversations.

Parameters:

subject (dict) – A dictionary containing conversation data.

Returns:

  • total_time (float) – Total conversation time in minutes.

  • max_time (float) – Maximum conversation time in minutes.

  • min_time (float) – Minimum conversation time in minutes.

  • times (int) – Number of conversations.

class vilt.timemanager.ProcessTimer(mdict, email)[source]

Bases: Process

A process that manages a countdown timer for a specific user session.

run()[source]

Runs the process timer, decrementing the timeout value at intervals.

Updates the timeout value for the user’s session.

Parameters:

value (int) – The new timeout value to set.

class vilt.usermanager.UserManager[source]

Bases: object

Manages user operations in the database, such as adding, deleting, and modifying users.

add_subject(email, selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

A method to assign a subject to a user (usually a teacher or a student).

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • selected_career (str) – The desired career to filter.

  • selected_subject (str) – The desired subject to filter.

Adds a new user to the database.

Parameters:

user (dict) – The user data in dictionary format.

delete_user(email, add_history=True)[source]

Removes a user from the database.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email of the user to delete.

  • add_history (bool, optional) – If True, stores the deleted user in the history database (default is True).

end_conversation(email, selected_career, selected_subject, text)[source]

A method to finish a conversation with the chatbot for the specific user identified by the email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • selected_career (str) – The desired career to filter.

  • selected_subject (str) – The desired subject to filter.

  • text (str) – The finished conversation between the user and the chatbot.

find_active_conversation_from_subject(email, selected_career, selected_subject)[source]

A function to find possible active conversations related to a specific subject.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • selected_career (str) – The desired career to filter.

  • selected_subject (str) – The desired subject to filter.

Returns:

  • position (int) – The position of the subject in the list of assigned subjects of the user. Note that if it is equal -1 then there is no related subject.

  • conv_position (int) – The position of the conversation in the list of conversations related to the subject. Note that if it is equal -1 then there is no conversation related to the assigned subject.

Parameters:

  • email (str)

  • user. (The email address of the)

  • position (int) – The position of the conversation in the list of assigned subjects of the user.

Returns:

sub_position – The position of the conversation in the list of conversations related to the assigned subjects of the user. Note that if it is equal -1 then there is no conversation.

Return type:

int

  • selected_subject (str) – The desired subject to filter.

update_feedback(email, position, conv_position, utility_feedback, learning_feedback, precision_feedback)[source]

A method to include the opinion of the users about the performance of the chatbot.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email address of the user.

  • position (int) – The position of the subject in the list of assigned subjects of the user.

  • conv_position (int) – The position of the conversation in the list of conversations related to the selected subjects of the user.

  • utility_feedback (str) – The value of the utility feedback provided by the user.

  • learning_feedback (str) – The value of the learning feedback provided by the user.

  • precision_feedback (str) – The value of the precision feedback provided by the user.
